content.html:
where I’m at currently with my riso design ????

Highlight of the week: playing around with my riso design, toying with halftones and textures and gradients and overlays, oh my! I need to remember that drawing is a thing I can do for fun ????

Looking forward to: riso class!

My energy remains lower than normal, maybe 70%, but I’m feeling more like myself again. I still have a small numb spot from some nerve damage below the biggest incision — from what I’ve read online it can take a few months for the nerves to reconnect (if they’re going to), so I’m holding out hope it’s not permanent.

Stuff I did:

  • Developed a loose budget for the new project, had a follow-up call, and got quotes from more vendors
  • Worked on my sign project for 2.5 hours, then I was wiped for the day ????
  • Researched risograph printing inspiration and illustrated a print for the class
  • Responded to an email interview about my creative process
  • Saw Dune: Part Two in theaters — the first time I’ve been to the movies since at least 2019, if not before! We went to a matinee to avoid people and it was less than $15 for two of us ????
  • Played around with the Open Heart Protocol that Benji shared a few weeks ago — didn’t quite get it working right but I think Benji’s pointed me the right way ????
  • Revisited how to prune my japanese laceleaf maple — I think it needs one whole branch taken to not hang in the sidewalk, so I am building up my resolve to make a significant cut
  • Big fridge cleanout to dump all the food that went bad while I was sick
  • One virtual appointment

Dinners:

  • Tomato soup from a box + toasted cheese
  • Eggplant tomato curry from Greenfeast: Autumn, Winter
  • ????‍♀️
  • Mexican takeout — burrito
  • Veggie quesadilla + store-bought guac
  • Harissa chickpea bowls
  • One-Pan Farro with Tomatoes and Kale ???? + garlic bread + dressed greens

Reading:

  • Read Liberty: British Colour Pattern
  • Re-read Beyond the Next Star by Melody Johnson
  • Continued reading You May Also Like by Tom Vanderbilt
  • Started reading The Mimicry of Known Successes by Malka Ann Older
  • DNF’d Emily Wilde’s Encyclopaedia of Faeries by Heather Fawcett, High Times in the Low Parliament by Kelly Robson, and Chaos Terminal by Mur Lafferty

Words I looked up / concepts I learned:

  • torpidity
  • envoi
  • recondite
  • limerence

Pretty stuff I saw:

by Bo Le
  • this candy-colored aerial photo of Mount Lofty Botanic Gardens, SA, by Bo Le
  • Reports from Unknown Places: March 10 by Ninn Salaün
  • Tamar Moshkovitz – Jellycats
  • Jessica Poundstone – Color Space 53
  • Benjamin Barreau – Chimeres – Lille
  • Andrew Vastagh – Menomena poster
  • Minna Leunig – Creatures We Walk With
  • this Tetris riso print from Risotto Studio
  • amethyst, black onyx, and diamond bracelet

New music I listened to:

  • Charli XCX – Von Dutch ????
  • Les Amazones d’Afrique – Flaws ????
  • Nusantara Beat – Kota Bandung ????
  • Some music from Habibi Funk

Neat stuff I learned:

  • a pectin-based nose spray may protect against Influenza A??? (pre-print) ????

Website changes:

  • Styled comments by author, which only recognizes native comments, not webmentions, so it’s easier to visually distinguish whether I replied to someone else or it’s just a pingback
  • Got my recipe cards to wrap on mobile

Nature notes:

  • Been hearing the chorus frogs even in the daytime sometimes this week
  • Spotted a good size garter snake (attempting to) sun itself on our front step
  • Lots of bees buzzing around — haven’t gotten a good look but they might be mason bees? (Saw one hovering near the old mason bee house on our back deck)
  • The neighborhood plum and cherry trees are in bloom ???????????? Red flowering currant racemes are opening!
